to make more of a name for herself as a
solo artist most notably with her very
successful debut 2019's Pang which at
the time was one of the better Art Pop
records to drop in a while and going
into this new LP I didn't really have
too many hopes or expectations other
than Caroline would sort of beat the
sophomore slump curse that she would
maybe up the ante a little bit possibly
show another side of herself or just
prove that Peng wasn't a fluke and yeah
as it turns out desire I want to turn
into you is a quite the impressive pop
record rules right from the intro track
Welcome to My Island which is an Anthem
that is as wide and as vast as a
mountain range complete with roaring 80s
Arena rock guitars and chance of hey hey
borderline unhinged but still very
powerful vocalizations from Caroline
herself jumping really high into her
falsetto range the whole track is a
triumphant shock to the system it's like
what standing under a waterfall must
feel like plus there's so much going on
on the track between the instrumentation
the establishing imagery of the record
too really feels like Caroline's using
music and art in this instance to enter
another world or plane of existence
which I think the cover here itself
depicts I mean look at her crawling with
headphones over her ears in what looks
like a Subway but just in front of her
is this whole body of sand as if what
she's moving toward where a beach or
something this track is also where the
title of this album is most heavily

this record to just embody something
else is intense Caroline is literally
proclaiming on this track she wants to
be a feeling on the following pretty
impossible we get these cute scatty

which give this track a kind of

Art Pop production and dynamic singing
keep the tracks sounding more modern

say the Dido feature on the back end of
the album makes so much more sense too
from here we have bunny as a rider which
I believe was the first taste we had of
this album cycle it has grown on me a
little bit since I originally caught it
but I'm still not crazy about how
skeletal the verses are as well as the
lyrics just being so repetitive the
track feels like it's missing the
extravagance that many of the other
songs on this LP bring though I do
respect that Caroline tries to use this
track as another opportunity to
reinforce the album's overall themes of
escapism the track Sunset though does
bring an interest twist to the table
where we essentially get a bit of
Flamenco pop with guitars and beats and

assembled in such a tight way they feel
kind of robotic synthetic I think the
idea is for the beat to sound I don't

smooth and organic contrast crude

bear feels a little Half Baked but the

on side B of Kate Bush's hounds of love

hope drunk ever asking which again while
it's on is stunningly beautiful people
and I just wish it had a stronger more

is one of a few tracks on here that

to
couching these songs and this music in
